metadata.Title: CVE-2023-38802 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
FRRouting FRR 7.5.1 through 9.0 and Pica8 PICOS 4.3.3.2 allow a remote attacker to cause a denial of service via a crafted BGP update with a corrupted attribute 23 (Tunnel Encapsulation).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-38802` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

frr - 8.4.4-1.1ubuntu1
frr-pythontools - 8.4.4-1.1ubuntu1
frr-rpki-rtrlib - 8.4.4-1.1ubuntu1
frr-snmp - 8.4.4-1.1ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> VINCE #1159 eslerm> frr merged patch on 2023-08-29 bcb6b58d9 ("bgpd: Use treat-as-withdraw for tunnel encapsulation attribute") quagga does not implement RFC 7606 mdeslaur> This was actually fixed in USN-6323-1, but was not listed because of a copy/paste error

criterions.comment: frr package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '8.4.4-1.1ubuntu1').
